results.title: The Comeback
results.brief_description: Arnold Schwarzenegger, world champion bodybuilder, attempts a comeback after a lengthy retirement. The film reveals the motivated psychology of a winner in sport. The tension and excitement backstage at the Mr Olympia contest at the Sydney Opera House provides a compelling insight to a sport that is generally regarded as little more than a freak show. Also features Tom Platz and Frank Zane.

results.title: The Color of paradise = The Colour of paradise
results.creator_credit: Majid Majidi, Mehdi Karimi and Varahonar Film Company
results.brief_description: After the end of term at a school for the blind in Teheran, Mohammed, an eight year old blind boy, and his father make the long journey on foot and horseback back to their village in the northern highlands of Iran. Though Mohammed quickly settles back into his idyllic life in the country with his two sisters and his grandmother, his widower father, who wants to remarry, decides to send him to work for a blind carpenter far from home. The film starts with a child’s perception of the world and expands its vision to encompass the emotional complexities of the adult world. Dividing the focus evenly between Mohammed and his father, it provides insight into wider social and cultural issues at play which resonate deeply through the caustic comments of the boy’s grandmother. While the soundtrack’s constantly shifting chorus of birds, insects, wind and rain draws attention to the sounds Mohammad hears, the film also reveals the beauty he is unable to see. Moving through fields of flowers and misty forests, across streams and into the craggy backwoods country, it offers a visionary experience of the natural world. Cast includes Hossein Mahjoub, Mohsen Ramezani, Salime Feizi and Farahnaz Safari. In Farsi with English subtitles.

results.title: The Cosmic link [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Catherine Fol, Eric Michel and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This award-winning documentary explores the age-old question of “life” - where do we come from, is there life on other planets, how did life begin? Planet Earth has only one life form: all life on Earth shares some of the same genetic code and has developed from the same evolutionary tree. It is recognised that humans and apes share 98% of the same DNA. But could life have evolved differently out there in the cosmos? Astrophysicists, geologists, biochemists, astronomers, and biopalaeontologists discuss their theories and discoveries, both on Earth and in space, to help shed some light on this mystery of life. Uses microphotography, 3D animation and some excellent cinematography to provide a visual spectacle to what has always been a fascinating subject for discussion. Narrated by Lynne Adams. In English and French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Control revolution
results.creator_credit: Richard Moore, KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.) and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: Explains how the development of the computer has made possible the automatic control of routine tasks in government, industry and business. Presents various computer systems ranging from data processing applications to mechanical control systems. Introduces basic concepts in business information systems including feedback, decision making processes and data modelling.

results.title: The Coca-Cola Kid
results.creator_credit: Dusan Makavejev, David Roe and Sylvie Le Clezio
results.brief_description: Droll, sometimes wacky comedy in which an American representative from the multi-national soft-drink company of the title heads for Australia to establish his company’s product as the beverage of choice and along the way ends up finding the road to success filled with obstacles that include a passionate romance. Stars Greta Scacchi and Eric Roberts. Cinematography by Dean Semler. Based on the Frank Moorhouse novel. Rated: M

results.title: The Contract
results.creator_credit: David Ogilvy, Australian Film Commission and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: A poignant drama about an ageing couple’s determination to retain their independence and the frustration felt by their son and his young family as they deal with situation. Stars Norma Kaye and Bunny Brooke.

results.title: The Conquered dream
results.creator_credit: Michael McKennirey, Richard Robinson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A documentary history of the exciting, sometimes ill-fated exploration of Canada’s Arctic, produced jointly by the British Broadcasting Corporation and the National Film Board of Canada. The film shows the challenge and the rewards of the far north and, from rare film footage, some of the exploits of the first and last men to run the gauntlet of the cold: Byrd’s flight; Stefansson’s sled journey; Captain Bernier’s explorations; and finally, the voyage of the U.S.S. Manhattan. Commentary written and spoken by Stanley Jackson.

results.title: The Concert for Bangla Desh
results.creator_credit: Saul Swimmer, Allen Klein, George Harrison, Apple and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Filmed live performance of a special benefit concert for the starving refugees of Bangla Desh in New York’s Madison Square Gardens in 1971. A collaborative effort by George Harrison and Ravi Shankar, this amazing concert assembled together some of the greats in the British and American rock music industry including Eric Clapton, Bob Dylan, Billy Preston, Leon Russell, Ringo Starr, Ali Akbar Khan, Klaus Voorman, Badfinger. The first half of the concert features an Indian music presentation led by Ravi Shankar followed by George Harrison and his guest performers in the second half. The concert raised $US250,000 with further monies raised through record sales. Songs include “My sweet Lord “, “It don’t come easy”, “Here comes the sun”, “Just like a woman”, “A Hard rain’s gonna fall”. Also includes documentary footage of Bangla Desh.

results.title: The Computer wore tennis shoes
results.creator_credit: Robert Butler, Bill Anderson and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Featuring a very young Kurt Russell as Dexter, student leader at Medfield College who is transformed into a human being with a hard drive memory when the computer he is repairing is unexpectedly struck by a bolt of lightning. This act of nature presents all manner of problems for Dexter as his brain begins to discover certain information about the somewhat suspect activities of the College’s rich benefactor A.J. Arno (Cesar Romero) who donated the computer in the first place. The story bounces along from adventure to adventure, revealing secrets and plans, a kidnapping and a rescue. Cast includes Joe Flynn, William Schallert, Alan Hewitt.

results.title: The Computer programme No. 6-10
results.creator_credit: Frank Ash, Matt Boney and BBC
results.brief_description: No.6 “Sound and Moving Pictures” - Shows the exciting potential of computer animation and art. No.7 “Let’s Pretend” - A lot can be learnt from an accurate model and one of the truly exciting capabilities of computers is simulation. No.8 “The Thinking Machine” - Computers can learn but this program asks if they can think. No.9 “In Control” - Shows the potential of computers to control aspects of our environment. No.10 “Things to Come” - Automation in farming and banking processes and unemployment consequences.
